<letter id="swk8022">
<recipient first="Robert" last="Stockton" type="individual"/>
</p><p>
HEAD-QUARTERS, ARMY OF THE WEST, 
<a href='/results.php?city=los angeles' rel='city origin'>Ciudad De Los Angeles</a>, <a rel="month origin" value="1">January</a> <a rel='day origin' value='17'>17</a>, <a href='/results.php?year=1847' rel="origin">1847</a>. 
</p><p>
SIR : I have to inform you that I intend to withdraw to-morrow from this place, with the small party which escorted me to this country. 
</p><p>
Very respectfully, your obedient servant, 
</p><p>
S. W. KEARNEY, 
Brigadier-General. 
</p><p>
COMMODORE K. F. STOCKTON, V. S. N., 
Acting Governor of California. 
</p><p>
</letter>
